data.title: A Good Dog in a Good Spot.
data.text:
It's not necessarily going to be "Good for You.." but; These dogs taste GOOD!!!  Great location on the Independence Square.  Plenty to chose from; a slight bit pricey, but worth it if you don't eat here constantly.

**Note:  there was a little boy in the restaurant playing with a toy caterpillar/backhoe -
moving it back and forth on the table and saying, "Ah beep, beep, beep, Ah beep beep beep".  It was awesome!!

data.title: Too expensive for fancy hot dogs
data.text: Family likes this place a lot, but it is very exepensive for well dressed hot dogs.  Service can be lacking sometimes.

data.title: Quick bite - lots of choice - reasonable price
data.text:
We ate at Up Dog - enjoyed it thoroughly! So many choices of ways to dress hot dogs (and chicken tenders). My husband had a second! Fast food but not fast food.
Enjoy!

data.title: Great for kids
data.text:
Great atmosphere for kids.  Makes eating much more pleasant!
Pleasant workers with great customer service.

data.title: Put a dog in your life
data.text: The service here is quick and friendly.  They only serve hot dogs but the selection is good, the dogs are plump and juicy and one will probably fill you up.  It is located in the old downtown part of Independence.

data.title: Dogs and fries on the square
data.text: The pictures of hot dogs on their menu will make you crave them. The dogs run about $4 depending on toppings, add fries or tots and a drink for $3. It's clean, has a old fashioned diner feel. And you can grab dessert next door at yogurtini place. And I like the water bowl for dogs they set out. Nice touch.

data.title: Fast, cheap and Yummy
data.text: Ate here after visiting the Truman Library. Good dogs, tots and onion rings. We had the bacon chili dog and my kids ate the corn dogs. We were all happy with our choices.

data.title: Wonderful service.  Good food.
data.text: I don't usually eat hot dogs, but I wanted to try this restaurant.  The staff was so friendly, and the food was great.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Really slow service and average food.
data.text: Granted each dog is freshly grilled, but the woman putting on condiments and serving was the slowest service person I think I have ever seen. We only got basic dogs, not the ones with fancy toppings, and it took a good 15-20 minutes. They were on,y average too.

data.title: Great dogs!
data.text: Great variety of hot dogs and very unique ones.  I had the chicago dog that was very good.  Prices reasonable, and located right on the corner of the square.  Quick service and very tasty.

data.title: Enjoy the menu, the staff however.......
data.text: The menu for The Up Dog is good and very different and the quality of the food is very good.  I love the fries.  The staff, however, leaves me not wanting to go back.  They text on their phones while taking your order and don't even make eye contact with you.  Employees from McClain's other businesses sit at the counter and distract the Up Dog employees and make fun of customers.  I have reached out to management and have received no response.  Sad thing is this is a unique place, clean and good food.  The staff is not making me want to go back.  Sad thing is it makes me not want to frequent any McClain establishment.

data.title: Unique hot dofgs
data.text: Up dog has a lot of really unique flavor combinations for their hotdogs. I'm not a huge fan of the style of dogs they use because they have a casing that tends to be pretty tough, but they do have really good mini corn dogs and honestly, the absolute best fries I've ever eaten. The place is pretty small, so it can get crowded at lunch hour and they have only two staff members most days. We've never had to wait too long for our food, though.

data.title: Nice surprise!
data.text: Nice variety of hot dogs...some very creative. Our toppings were tasty and fresh.  Service was super friendly and accommodating.  Cute decor.  Fun place!

data.title: HOT DOG SNACK BAR
data.text: We received prompt, friendly service with a great menu of various dogs. The eating area was clean and inviting. Recommend!

data.title: Great for a quick lunch or snack
data.text: My husband is a lover of hot dogs so he insisted we go in for lunch.  Staff was friendly and answered our numerous questions.  Allowed us to basically build our own dogs.  All of the buns including the poppy seed are made of egg bread.  Personal preference, but all three of us eating don't care for egg bread.  We live near Chicago so we're spoiled with their dogs.  Up Dog had a lot of choices.  Unfortunately none of them appealed to us so we went with plain plus condiments.  They could use a better brand of hot dog to overall improve things.  There was a sode dispenser for free refills and everything was very clean.

data.title: OK but not my type of hotdog
data.text: They have several different ways to eat your hotdog. Some ways I never heard about. Hotdogs have cassings don't like that. Plus just different. Won't go back. But if in the area try it. You might like it

data.title: Fun twist on hotdogs!
data.text: We went here and tried several of the different hot dogs off the menu. I liked the ones with crunchy potatoe chips on the top! It's a very cool 50s diner style restaurant with booths and a barstool seating area too! It's right on the independence square so lots of shopping and dessert with in walking distance!

data.title: Good Diner Atmosphere
data.text: Checked out this place since I saw an advertisement at our hotel. Great for the hot dog lover especially if you like all different styles of dogs. Cute diner and it's right across the street from historic markers showing where the Oregon and Santa Fe trails began.

data.title: great variety and very tasty!
data.text: Stopped in here for a quick lunch and was quite pleased! The staff was all very friendly and we received our food quickly. Loved the onion rings -- they were tossed in a lemon pepper mixture that was outstanding. Nice variety of hot dog toppings to choose from. Would have liked to be able to try them all :) Wait staff was willing to answer all my questions too -- wondered just what pink sauce was (mixture of ketchup and mayo), what do people get peanut butter sauce on (just about everything) and does the menu every change (sometimes, depending on popularity of items). A fun little place with good food.

data.title: Vintage Spot with Great Dogs
data.text: This restaurant is in a vintage 50's-ish spot.  It was fun to walk in and feel like we'd stepped back in time.  There are many hot dog choices.  If you like hot dogs, there is one for you here.  However, hot dogs is all they serve.
